intro: Arabis hirsuta var. purpurea, commonly known as purple hairy rockcress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Its leaves are hairy and basal, while the flowers are small, four-petaled, and usually pink or purple in color. It is a perennial plant that produces a capsule fruit containing numerous seeds.
